subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the number of parameters of a method or constructor.

tr.td: Ignore methods and constructors annotated with the specified annotation(s).
Ignore number of parameters for methods with @Override annotation.
Specify the maximum number of parameters allowed.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to allow 10 parameters for a method:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="ParameterNumber"> <property name="max" value="10"/> <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_DEF"/> </module> </module> </module>
subsection.p: To configure the check to ignore number of parameters for methods with @Override or @java.lang.Override annotation.
Rationale: developer may need to override method with many parameters from 3-rd party library. In this case developer has no control over number of parameters.
To configure the check to ignore methods and constructors annotated with JsonCreator annotation:
Note: Annotation names specified in the ignoreAnnotatedBy property must be an exact match for the annotation name on the method or constructor.

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
